choices.answer: Patterns and trends used to solve a problem
A set of step-by-step instructions to resolve a problem
A programming language
To plan out the solution to a problem
As a platform to program a solution
To test a solution to a problem

questions.question: How can an algorithm be represented?

choices.answer: As a flowchart
As pseudocode
As a flowchart or pseudocode
A diagram that represents a set of instructions
A high-level language that has specific syntax
A way of describing a set of instructions.

questions.question: What is the correct symbol for a process instruction in a flowchart?

choices.answer: A rectangle
A parallelogram
A square

questions.question: What is the correct symbol for an output in a flowchart?

choices.answer: A parallelogram
A rectangle
A diamond

questions.question: What is the correct symbol for a decision in a flowchart?

choices.answer: A rectangle
A diamond
A square
Adding detail to make a problem more complex
When you ignore the unnecessary detail in a problem
Breaking down a complex problem into smaller, easier parts

questions.question: Why do we decompose a complex problem?

choices.answer: To make it more difficult to solve
To change the problem we have
To make it easier to solve

questions.question: How often do we decompose problems?

choices.answer: We never decompose them, computers do this for us
On a daily basis, often without thinking about it
Occasionally, but we don't really need to

questions.question: Which of these would NOT be involved in decomposing a problem?

choices.answer: Think how the problem can be divided into smaller parts
Working out who could help you solve a part of the problem
Adding more parts to the problem so it becomes more complex

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of thinking computationally?

choices.answer: Planning out your route when going to meet a friend
When going to meet a friend, wander around till you find him
When going to meet a friend, asking a parent to plan a route

questions.question: Which computational thinking technique involves breaking a problem down into smaller parts?

choices.answer: Decomposition
Abstraction
Algorithms
Breaking down a complex problem into smaller problems
Building models from patterns
Looking for similarities among and within problems

questions.question: Why do we need to look for patterns in problems?

choices.answer: Patterns make it easier for us to solve complex problems
Patterns make it more difficult to solve complex problems
We don't need to look for patterns

questions.question: Which of the following contains a pattern?

choices.answer: All cars have wheels
My car is blue
My friend's car has an MP3 player

questions.question: Which of the following contains a pattern?

choices.answer: This parrot is blue and green
All parrots have wings
My parrot can say "Hello, boys!"

questions.question: Which of the following does NOT contain a pattern?

choices.answer: All dogs have tails
Our dogs like walks
My dog likes swimming
